As soon as I asked the receptionist, I want a distinguished young barber, especially in haircuts, and you said they are all the same, no one is distinguished from the other. I got a haircut from the one you sent me to for a haircut and beard cut of 50 riyals. I found that he was not skilled in cutting hair or beards, and so are the rest of the barbers like him, according to what you said, they are all the same.

(Translated by Google)
Masha' Allah, Tabarak Allah, one of the best barbers in Makkah.

First, the barbers' respect and hospitality.
Second, the general cleanliness of the shop, Masha' Allah, is the best there is.
Third, the cleanliness during the haircut, in terms of the gloves, scissors, and comb, which come out in the bag in front of you. The sterilization is very, very excellent.

The price for the service provided is very, very satisfactory, and I hope the price remains the same.

They have a very nice feature, the appointments. If you want a haircut, you have to book. There is no preference between customers. This is a very excellent feature from the owner.

Guys, I recommend you get a haircut from them. By God, they are very distinguished.

Hamza in particular is a very, very respectful person, his speech is organized, and he is skilled at carving and grading. May Allah bless the shop owner and all those who work in the shop for their respect, organized speech, and respect for the customers. We have wished for this level from the beginning. May Allah bless you...
